meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site chafes my nerves.
meanings.sent2: Her constant complaining chafes her friends.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy chafes the cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive music chafes my ears like sandpaper.
meanings.sent5: The rough fabric chafes my skin uncomfortably.

meanings.definition: To rub or wear away by friction
meanings.sent1: The rough rocks chafe the skin on my knees.
meanings.sent2: The old shoes chafe my heels when I walk long distances.
meanings.sent3: The rusty gate chafes against the fence, leaving marks.
meanings.sent4: The constant use of the pencil chafes the eraser away.
meanings.sent5: The sandpaper slowly chafes away the rough edges of the wood.

meanings.definition: To become sore or irritated from rubbing
meanings.sent1: After hiking all day, my feet chafe and blister.
meanings.sent2: The tight clothing chafes the skin, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The tag on the shirt chafes my neck, making me itch.
meanings.sent4: The friction from the rope chafes the skin on my hands.
meanings.sent5: The rough rope chafes against the tree bark, creating friction.
